ISSUE.TITLE: Improve (error) tracing for script invocations
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Flowable provides the ability to use scripts at different places in models (taskListener, executionListener, script tasks, httpHandlers, human tasks etc.) * Scripts are therefore executed originating from different contexts using the `ScriptEngines` class. In case of script invocations resulting in errors, it is hard to trace down which script failed, because the exception does not provide enough context information, where the error originated. This is especially true for big modeling projects relying in heavy scripting. * The ScriptEngines shall be extended with APIs, such that clients can tag script invocations with additional meta information. This allows to add enough information on the caller side, to be able to trace down the problem and locate the origin in case of errors. * The tracing ability shall not be restricted to errors only, but shall also allow to extract meta information about script invocations, such that they could be piped into a metrics data provider for operational analytics, like micrometer. * Tracing and monitoring errors is the main use case

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Corrected dead letter job query external worker filter (#3415) (#3416)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Improve (error) tracing for script invocations #3425 * The ScriptEngines has been extended with APIs, such that clients can now tag script requests with meta information. This allows to add enough information to be able to trace down the origin in case a script invocation fails. * The APIs have been designed to be flexible enough to also potentially use them as a source for operational analytics metrics using a `ScriptTraceListener` on `ScriptingEngines`.
